page.title: 16A POLICEMAN ON UNEMPLOYMENT
page.content: I interviewed a policeman who has served in the Merseyside Police Force for ten years.I asked him what he thought about the employment situation and what could be done to create more jobs.He said "The government should encourage wives to stay at home or help with voluntary aid,for example the elderly.This could be achieved by a tax allowance for the working husband.This would then enable jobs to be found for the young and unemployed. The government should also create public work schemes,for example the rebuilding of the Victorian sewers which are falling apart,and the repair of roads.This could create further problems in the short term because of the added cost of paying the extra workers recruited but eventually these costs will be met by the reduction in the unemployment benefits".
